p: More stringent criteria regarding the activity were described by Saraiva [ 57] and Silva et al. [ 58], which specifically indicated that when MIC values < 100 μg/mL have been recorded, activity is described as high; when the obtained values are between 100 and 500 μg/mL, it is considered active; for those between 500 and 1000 μg/mL, activity is described as moderately active; for those between 1000 and 2000 μg/mL, activity is described as low; and those with MIC > 2000 μg/mL are described as inactive.
